    • Method Detail

      • passwordEncoder

        @Bean
public org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder()
        Used to hash passwords on registration and check that they match at login
        Returns:
        BCryptPasswordEncoder

      • getUsers

        public java.util.List<User> getUsers()
        Gets all registered users, and returns a list (made into a JSON in the controller)
        Returns:
        List of all users registered

      • getUserByName

        public User getUserByName(java.lang.String username)
        Gets a specific user by name. This assumes the user is registered, as it's checked in the controller via calling checkUserExists.
        Parameters:
        username - String of the username of the User to be returned
        Returns:
        User with matching username
        See Also:
        User

      • checkUserExists

        public boolean checkUserExists(java.lang.String username)
        Checking is a user is registered or not.
        Parameters:
        username - String of User's username that you're checking
        Returns:
        boolean based on if user exists or not

      • save

        public void save(User user)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Custom save function to save a user to the database. Custom so that we hash the password before adding the user's information to the database.
        Parameters:
        user - User model to save. Password is just a string when being passed in
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If a user with the username already exists, we throw an exception.

      • login

        public boolean login(User u)
        A login function to ensure that the user logging in has matching credentials to one in the database.
        Parameters:
        u - User model containing only username and password that is sent from a login request
        Returns:
        boolean depending on if username and password match the user's credentials in the database
